sub_title: Board Game Developer ~ Designer | Video specialist  | Graphic designer
summary:
I am a freelance board game designer and board game developer.

Being very experience as a board game developer I have been working for publisher 999 Games in the past years, creating many beautiful games such as Queensland, ZINGA, Sneaky Bastard and future releases (Top Secret). I am also the designer and developer of the Mega Games: Mega Civilization, Western & Eastern Empires.

In addition to this, I work and have been working in other fields. These include:

- YouTube strategy for companies
- YouTube algorythm specialist
- Online video specialist (audience growth, outreach)
- Video production (Full package: script, direction, editing, audio)
- Video editing (FCPX, AVID, Premiere, After Effects)
- Graphic design
- Video localization (subtitles, re-editing, the details)

I am well experienced in these softwares:
- Adobe Photoshop, Premiere, After Effects, Indesign
- Final Cut Pro X
- Google sheets / Excel formulas
- YouTube CMS

I have working experience in the following
- SEO / SEA using google and facebook ads.

Competencies
- Setting priorities
- Practical
- Task oriented
- Intense and thorough
- Focus on long term
- I see all the details
- Learn easily
- Not easily stressed
- Empathic
- Creative
- I am a talented writer in Dutch and English
 
Passions:
- Specialism scuba diving (a.o. caves)
- Archaeology
- Bronze age history
- Vincent van Gogh (to the extreme)
- Mauk Escher
- Popquiz (premier league)
- Making music (guitar, piano, singing)
- Quantum mechanics
- Playing heavy board games
- Designing board games

Achievements
- I have sold thousands of copies worldwide of my own game designs
- For VPRO I have earned 8 Silver Creator awards for various YouTube chanels, built up from scratch

treasury_media.title: Klokhuis - Het Kantoor 273 - 10:00 Hoe maak je een bordspel
treasury_media.description: Full episode of Het Klokhuis. From 10:00 I am interviewed on Board Game Design.

treasury_media.title: Hoe maakt 999 Games een spel - VOLLEDIGE DOCUMENTAIRE
treasury_media.description: Interview documentary on Board Game Design

treasury_media.title: Hoe de VPRO zijn video’s viral laat gaan
treasury_media.description: Lubachs wereldhits op YouTube zijn geen toeval, maar gevolg van een doordachte strategie

treasury_media.title: Interview Flo de Haan - Ontwikkeling Mega Civilization
treasury_media.description: Just do it! Ik heb door de jaren zoveel mensen gesproken die niet durven, of geen tijd hebben, of geen mensen kennen om te testen of wat voor excuus ook. Als je wat wilt in het leven moet je het gewoon doen. NU, en niet morgen. Toen ik Mega Civilization wilde spelen met 18 spelers had ik ook geen 18 spelers, dus ik heb stuk voor stuk mensen moeten overtuigen om mee te spelen. En je moet gewoon niet opgeven. Blijf in jezelf geloven, en blijf kritisch.

treasury_media.title: Western Empires Trailer - 999 Games
treasury_media.description: Western Empires is a board game for 5 to 9 players that covers the development of ancient civilizations over 8000 years of history. This is not just a regular game. Western Empires can take up to 12 hours to complete. And still yet, it has a simple...

treasury_media.title: Youtube versus Facebook voor Arjen Lubach
treasury_media.description: De NPO wilde geen Youtube maar Lubach wist de NPO bazen te overtuigen. “Ik zei: ‘Dat is de enige manier waarop je je programma aan de jeugd kan aanbieden.’ Dat vonden ze dan ook wel weer heel waardevol.”

treasury_media.title: Marianne Kalkman on Twitter
treasury_media.description: “Workshop Go viral met Flo de Haan, slimme tips! RT @socialoque: Shares, likes, comments zijn belangrijker dan views #youtube #impact #kringuck”

treasury_media.title: Western Empires
treasury_media.description: As soon as Flo and John met through a forum, they decided to work together to develop a new bigger game, each on either side of the ocean. A new approach with new original rules. In the meantime Gerart de Haan joined, and it took about ten years of development and testing, as 18 players is not a team you gather every week.

treasury_media.title: Mega Civilization
treasury_media.description: This is Flo de Haan unpacking the very first game of Mega Civilization

awards.title: YouTube Silver creator award for VPRO Vrije Geluiden
awards.description:
This channel was connected to the television program Vrije Geluiden up to 2019, when the TV-program stopped. However, the YouTube channel lives on. Full of live performances of world music artists and interviews about their music.

In 2018 we did thorough analysis on why some videos gained longer watch times than other and improved our strategy with it. This resulted in the milestone of 100.000 subscribers in April 2020, even though no new videos are uploaded anymore.

awards.title: YouTube Silver Creator Award for VPRO 3voor12
awards.description: This channel depicts new alternative music, live concerts in the Netherlands and interviews and specials with Dutch artists. I have edited videos for this channel, defined strategy and rewritten a lot of metadata. In January 2020 this channel achieved the milestone of 100.000 subscribers.

awards.title: Special CUSTOM medal of honor - Silver Creator award
awards.description: I received this special custom Silver Creator award from YouTube for achieving 5 Silver creator awards, and over a million subscribers on all channels combined for VPRO.

awards.title: YouTube Silver Play Button for VPRO Documentary (100.000 subscribers)
awards.description: This channel contains localized adaptations of documentaries primary produced for television. Focus on international audience.

awards.title: YouTube Silver Play Button for VPRO Toren C (100.000 subscribers)
awards.description: This channel contains short comedy videos. With our team we have grown the channel from 10K subscribers to 150K subscribers in 1 year.

awards.title: YouTube Silver Play Button for VPRO.nl (100.000 subscribers)
awards.description: For our corporate VPRO YouTube channel where we publish webseries, one-offs and the highlights of tv-shows of VPRO we are awarded the Silver Play button for 100.000 subscribers.

awards.title: YouTube Silver Play Button for VPRO Metropolis (100.000 subscribers)
awards.description: For our international project where we publish and subtitle VPRO programs in Three languages (English, Spanish and French) on three different YouTube channels, we created this channel to focus on a younger audience (25-35) with short video about unique people all over the world.

awards.title: Most watched video on YouTube in the Netherlands in 2017
awards.description: The video "The Netherlands welcomes Donald Trump in his own words" by VPRO Zondag met Lubach was the most wachted video in the Netherlands in 2017. I was responsible for the strategy, metadata and digital rights management. We worked for a full week to make this single video stand out and we did a great job. The two versions (a Dutch subtitled, and an English subtitled) were watched over 35 million times in 2017 alone. This was a result of the long term strategy for the channel that I initiated two years before with a intensive and interactive publication strategy.

awards.title: YouTube Silver Play Button for the channel VPRO Zondag met Lubach (100.000 subscribers)
awards.description:
In February 2015 I initiated and created this YouTube channel for Arjen Lubach’s Zondag met Lubach and set a strategy which we improved along the way. With a very small team we published video’s on sundaynight every week. In the low season we served highlights of previous season to not decrease viewership. We added specialized metadata and thumbnails in order reach a public as large as possible. The main target was to reach a huge number of subscribers and increasing watch time.  

In December 2016 we achieved the magical milestone of 100.000 subscribers. Just 76 days later we had already doubled that number to 200.000!

Currently the channel has apr. 500.000 subscribers

awards.title: #1 boardgame hotlist on BoardGameGeek
awards.description: We were #1 one for a week on the boardgame hotlist on the international Boardgame community BoardGameGeek for our game Mega Civilization.

certifications.name: AVID Media Composer for advanced editors

projects.title: Exoplanet - Board game development
projects.description:
In this project I have worked closely together with the designer of this game, Klaus-Jürgen Wrede (Carcassonne) to redevelop a previous release into a complete new design for the modern market.

Concept: You arrive with four teams on a newly discovered planet in outer space. It's time to explore and build a viable living place for generations to come. You have to plan and find resources and discover new species. At the same time cope with constant power failures, tornados and magnetic fields.

I have done the development, balancing, testing, rulebook and art direction.
In this project I have worked with illustrator Piotr Rossa, who uses AI as a tool for art development

contributors.headline: Board Game Developer ~ Designer | Video specialist  | Graphic designer

projects.title: The Brain - card game development
projects.description:
In this project I have worked closely together with the designer of this game, Peter Jürgensen to develop this idea into a published game.

Concept: You and your fellow player form a brain together, but cannot communicate. You have to figure out by deduction, counting, timing and a bit of luck how to get rid of all the cards. If you manage to do so the level increases. Beware of ducks killing dragons while they are hunting for zombies.

I have done the development, balancing, testing, rulebook and art direction.
Starting as 'Five kills' I have redeveloped this game into 'The Brain'.

contributors.headline: Board Game Developer ~ Designer | Video specialist  | Graphic designer
QA-Tester bei Toadman Interactive (publ)

projects.title: Blasting Billy - Board Game development
projects.description:
In this project I have worked closely together with one of the designers of this game, Leo Colovini to develop this idea into a published game. Gabriele Bubola was not involved in this process.

I haven’t changed anything to the rules, however, I have reworked the storyline to fit the game better in the 999 Games catalog, and to match the target audience. I did rewrite the rules and included examples.

Original concept: Barbanera. Barbanera is a mighty and evil pirate. You have to split the loot, but he wants the largest part of each of the types within the loot. He will put you in jail if you fail that request. The only players running for victory will be the players that are not in jail. 

Final product:  You and your gang have robbed the bank. The leader Blasting Billy is remorseless and wants the biggest part of each type of stolen goods. Be sure to take as much as you can, but never have more than Billy. Otherwise he will shoot you down. Or you can blast a part of the loot with dynamite. The winner will be the one that is not shot down and has the second biggest loot, after Blasting Billy.

The main work was the storyline, including the art direction. Dutch illustrator Thijs Rozema helped to get the right feeling of an evil Wild West Cowboy, yet don’t scare away the younger children or the parents. Being both scary and attractive for a broad audience.

contributors.headline: Board Game Developer ~ Designer | Video specialist  | Graphic designer
titolare presso studiogiochi sas
Freelance illustrator bij Thijs Rozema
HR Legal Consultant

projects.title: Queensland - Board game development
projects.description:
I have been in contact with designer Matt Wolfe for a while, and saw many concepts, but this concept made the difference. In this project I have worked closely together with the designer to develop this idea into a published game for 999 Games. I’ve redone the balancing of the victory points and reduced the game time. Finding the right style of artwork to fit the family audience proved a real challenge. Together with Dutch illustrator Marlies Barends I have managed to find the right approach.

Original Concept: Based on a true story. A hundred years ago they introduced the highly poisonous toad, now known as the cane toad to destroy a type of insect on sugar cane farms. Instead of doing their intended job they moved away and ate everything else. The toads have become a pest to date.

In the game your Australian farm is run over by the toads. While you try to expand your terrain you have to catch them alive to score victory points and at the same time keep your farm up and running. At the end of the game you score for having specific items on your farm that weren’t destroyed by the toads.

contributors.headline: Board Game Developer ~ Designer | Video specialist  | Graphic designer
Senior Technical Writer for ADP

projects.title: Willemsen de Koning - Board Game
projects.description:
The company Willemsen de Koning is a taxi company that proves that taxi transport is more than a journey from A to B. They are specialized in ‘transport with care’ for children that need special attention, elderly people and people with disabilities. They have requested 999 games to develop a game for them that they could provide to their clients and personnel

I have designed the game from scratch. They have specifically requested a game that looks like ‘CATAN’, but has the feeling of ‘Ticket to ride’. I started with the hexagon tiles but this time the tiles have routes on them where the taxi van will ride. 

Game concept: WDK-game. Players use cards to move their vans in order to pick up children and drop them at school. The first to do so might win, however, some children have autism and need to be picked up in the right order. If you don’t respect that you will be penalized. Will you go for speed, or for ‘transport with care’. Action cards will help you put the children in contact with their parents, move around roadblocks, find a shortcut or put other players in a traffic jam.

The illustrations were done by Fiore Gmbh.

projects.title: Zinga - Board game development
projects.description:
The couple Dennis and Esmée were at home during one of the COVID-19 lockdowns and were looking to create a game to have a fun time with. They basically combined Yahtzee and BINGO. While this seems very simple to do, they have managed to make this into something new, that has not been seen a lot. They have added just the right touch, and have published the game in private print as ‘Dobbeltime’ in the Netherlands in low numbers.

For 999 Games I have developed this game into something for a bigger and international audience to sell big numbers. To achieve this, I had to overcome some challenges, mainly mathematically.

Original concept Dobbeltime: Each player has a scoring sheet, containing a grid of 5x5 numbers between 1 and 12. But there are 4 different sheets. One player rolls the dice, 1 white and 5 different colored dice. As soon as a player sees a combination of the white die and a colored die, he may cross that exact number from his sheet. The active play may ignore the white die. But as soon as a player makes a mistake he has to mark that. Three faults means you’ve lost the game. A blue pawn can be used to keep players from winning.
Five in a row wins you the game.

In this project I have worked closely together with the designers of this game, Dennis Harmsen & Esmée Spaargaren to develop this idea into a published game. The main challenge was to create 4 equally balanced sheets that both contain all possible numbers and an evenly division of easier and harder numbers in the right colors. Evenly divided in horizontal, vertical, diagonal and compared to other sheets.

The second thing I’ve worked on is the name: ZINGA! A combination of the sound of the bell, the excitement of YAHTZEE! and the feeling of BINGO!. A very powerful artwork, developed in-house at 999 Games completes the story.

Resume Made by Flo: development, creation of testable prototype, testing, writing the rulebook, editing the rulebook, theme development, art direction, production briefing.

projects.title: Don Juan - Token card game development
projects.description:
Brazilian game designer Marcelo Nery came up with this concept which I pitched to 999 Games.
It was decided to step away from a student audience and rather focus on a family audience. 

The main concept was invented by Marcelo, but I have introduced some new mechanics to it. I’ve rewritten the rules and added components to make the actions more streamlined, easier to understand, and along the way decreased the game length to ensure the target audience will rather play several games in a row.

The storyline was almost perfectly described by Marcelo, and all I had to find was the right illustrator. Gael Lannurien (Ginkgopolis) proved to be the right option, using bright and colorful images that attract the family audience.

Original Concept: Don Juan. You are madly in love with Don Juan and are eagerly waiting for his love letters, but he sends those letters to many girls, not only to you. Sick of jealousy, you and your competitors alternate in helping the postman out. You all rearrange and hide each other's letters. Find the letters of your own and prevent others from receiving theirs. And then there’s special letters. Trade in three of your own letters into a heart token. Three hearts in the color of your opponents will break their hearts. Three hearts wins you the game. Keep a close eye on who holds which letters.

Resume Made by Flo: development, creation of testable prototype, testing, writing the rulebook, editing the rulebook, art direction, production briefing.

contributors.headline: Board Game Developer ~ Designer | Video specialist  | Graphic designer
Senior Game Designer

projects.title: Sneaky Bastard
projects.description:
The game concept called ‘Sneaky Snacks’ was offered to 999 Games by author Robert Brouwer, and proved a very nice and original mechanic. But, the target audience (students) and the suggested theme would not match. Therefore I tried and tested various themes and eventually developed the current theme. The game mechanics didn’t change but adding the right artwork proved the gimmick here. Each card has a little joke in it. People love the funny images of each single card, greatly drawn by illustrator Yonatan Mantzur. Perfectly fitting the student audience. 

Original concept: Sneaky Snacks. Players try to catch monsters by luring them with hamburgers. Monsters eat hamburgers and… monsters. You can lure them with smaller monsters. A ‘sneaky’ card will steal the lure from other players. The winner of the game is the player with the most monsters. Hamburgers don’t grant points.

Final product: Sneaky Bastard. The storyline is about the housing shortage in the Netherlands in the late 2010s. Since placing bids on houses and overbidding when buying was a very common procedure, this is exactly what you must do in the game. Estate agents and lenders are represented by ‘Sneaky bastards’, cunning businessmen and women. They will take your money if you push your luck too far. And you… You end up with houses either too good to be true, or castles in the air.

contributors.headline: Board Game Developer ~ Designer | Video specialist  | Graphic designer

projects.title: De schat van Kadora - Card game development
projects.description:
In this project I have worked closely together with the representative Italian designer of this game, Leo Colovini on behalf of Felix Bernat Julian to develop this game into a published game for the Dutch market.

999 Games was planning to publish the card game called Conclave in a license strictly for The Netherlands. The game needed localization, since the theme of the concept (Roman Catholic Church) is merely an Italian culture, whereas in the Netherlands 999 Games requested a theme and storyline more fitting to their own catalog and public. I have created a nice storyline perfectly fitting mechanics. The game is now about exploring sailors finding a haunted treasure on the island Kadora. In addition I have added 2-player rules. With Dutch illustrator Rogier van de Beek we could create a wonderful looking card game.

The Austrian licensee Piatnik has developed the theme for their audience into Kleine Kläffer.

Original concept Conclave: You have to take the most cards of at least a single family (color) but get rid of all the other cards that you don’t have the most of. playing is done by placing in and taking from a grid of cards. 

Final Product De Schat van Kadora: You have to get the most diamonds of at least one color out of six colors of diamonds to release the curse of a haunted pirate treasure. To achieve this you must make many trades on the table. The player with the most points wins the game.

I have done the development, balancing, testing, rulebook and art direction. I have also developed and tested alternative rules for 2 players.

contributors.headline: Board Game Developer ~ Designer | Video specialist  | Graphic designer
titolare presso studiogiochi sas
Art director at Illuvium.io

projects.title: Samoa - Card game development
projects.description:
Author: Lars Jansen
Developer: Flo de Haan for 999 Games

Introduced as 'Neon Party' (privately printed), I've reworked the game into 'SAMOA' to be published by 999 Games.

In this project I have worked closely together with the designer of this game, Lars Jansen to develop this idea into a published game. I have suggested and tested rule changes, added cards, done the development, and did balancing, testing, rulebook writing and art direction. I have created the best storyline for this game that started as a very abstract mechanic. Eventually after optimizing the story into the mechanics, I’ve found the right illustrator in Andrew Bosley (Everdell - Tapestry)  and this transformed the game from an abstract concept to a nice and attractive family card game. The funny characters of the masks that were developed in cooperation with Andrew contribute greatly to the experience of the game.

Original concept: Neon Party. Each player has one (out of five) secret identifier card and plays rounds where they place value cards at either of those. You must find the one identifier belonging to each of the other players and at the same time place as many value cards at your own to score points. At the end of the game you score additional points for each well guessed identifier card. But as soon as all other players guess your identifier right, you score no points at all.

Final product: SAMOA. It’s the Great Mask Festival on Samoa. Each mask belongs secretly to a player. You must decorate your own mask with coloured feathers that you find on the beach. If everyone knows which mask is yours, you're out. If not, you score points for the number of feathers and for guessing each other player's masks. Now you know each other's strategy, play another 2 rounds (instead of 1) and see if you can read minds.

contributors.headline: Board Game Developer ~ Designer | Video specialist  | Graphic designer

projects.title: Western Empires Boardgame
projects.description:
Adaptation and upgrade of a previous board game that we have designed and published in 2015.

This is an easy to learn though complex board game that takes 12 hours to play an can be played with 5-9 players. It can even be extended by a future release to support 18 players, and still take 12 hours to complete.

projects.title: Vincent Van Gogh Life study and travel.
projects.description:
I have travelled and visited each and every (possible) place where Vincent Van Gogh has been in his life. Chronologically. Every house. Every drawing. Every location he has written about. Every place where people lived that he has visited. And of course... every location where he painted his painting. Not only the highlights. ALL of them. Reading the complete letters along with it, on site.

All well documented with pictures. Unpublished. Purely done for own study.

profile_positions.company: Flo de Haan - Board Game Developer
profile_positions.description:
You can hire me for:
- Thorough development of a board game
- Project management of the full development
- Editor in chief
- External testing
- Writing the rulebook
- Theme/storyline development and art direction
- Creation of component list and artwork briefing
- Graphic design
- experience with Kickstarter
- Many more... contact me, let's talk!
profile_positions.title: Board Game Developer and Designer

profile_positions.description:
- YouTube specialist
- Video-editing
- Video-producing
- Board game design and development.
- Copywriting and text editing
- Advise for any of the subjects above

- Software: Adobe Photoshop  - Premiere - After Effects - Indesign, Apple Final Cut Pro. Various specialist tools.

- Customers: 999 Games, Paaspop, Zwarte Cross, Lowlands, Mojo Concerts, Pupkin, Visual Jammin, Vara-BNN, IDTV, Burgers' Zoo Arnhem. Various middle size companies.
profile_positions.title: Video Producer / Video Editor / Boardgame Designer

profile_positions.description:
1. Design and development of board games and card games for an international market.
2. Theme development and art direction for games in production
3. Design from scratch for board games in commission for other companies

- International contact for game designers and graphic artists.
- Scouting for game concepts worldwide
- Project Management
- Defining target audience and matching it
- Developing the game rules / scoring / length
- Writing the rulebook
- Creation of prototype
- Large scale external testing
- Developing the theme and storyline
- Art direction and scouting for illustrators
- Coordination of translation process
- Coordination of production process
- Quality control


Note: This job is independent of the games I have designed on my own, such as Mega Civilization and Western/Eastern Empires which are also published by 999 Games. A selection of games I have developed for the company in this job are Exoplanet, ZINGA, Queensland, The Brain, Blasting Billy, Sneaky Bastard.

A full list of game I have worked on can be found on my BoardGameGeek Designer profile.
https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgamedesigner/85691/flo-de-haan
